title: Google\Cloud\Translate\V3\ListGlossariesRequest
name: ListGlossariesRequest
description:
Request message for ListGlossaries.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.translation.v3.ListGlossariesRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.parent
params.description: Required. The name of the project from which to list all of the glossaries.

params.name: data.page_size
params.description: Optional. Requested page size. The server may return fewer glossaries than requested. If unspecified, the server picks an appropriate default.

params.name: data.page_token
params.description: Optional. A token identifying a page of results the server should return. Typically, this is the value of [ListGlossariesResponse.next_page_token] returned from the previous call to ListGlossaries method. The first page is returned if page_tokenis empty or missing.

params.name: data.filter
params.description: Optional. Filter specifying constraints of a list operation. Specify the constraint by the format of "key=value", where key must be "src" or "tgt", and the value must be a valid language code. For multiple restrictions, concatenate them by "AND" (uppercase only), such as: "src=en-US AND tgt=zh-CN". Notice that the exact match is used here, which means using 'en-US' and 'en' can lead to different results, which depends on the language code you used when you create the glossary. For the unidirectional glossaries, the "src" and "tgt" add restrictions on the source and target language code separately. For the equivalent term set glossaries, the "src" and/or "tgt" add restrictions on the term set. For example: "src=en-US AND tgt=zh-CN" will only pick the unidirectional glossaries which exactly match the source language code as "en-US" and the target language code "zh-CN", but all equivalent term set glossaries which contain "en-US" and "zh-CN" in their language set will be picked. If missing, no filtering is performed.

methods.description:
